lead_paragraph: Years of safety lapses as well as petty annoyances reveal how a grand vision of American liberalism has collided with reality.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and NICHOLAS FANDOS

headline.print_headline: Capital’s Metro, Creaking at 40, Is Staring Down a Midlife Crisis
headline.main: Washington Metro, 40 and Creaking, Stares at a Midlife Crisis

snippet: Years of safety lapses as well as petty annoyances reveal how a grand vision of American liberalism has collided with reality.
abstract: Subway system serving Washington, DC, faces deteriorating infrastructure and cash deficits as it hits 40th year in operation; city's transit authority has announced that nation's second-busiest transit system could face $100 million budget deficit in coming year, and that whole lines may be shut down for months for critical repairs to aging system.
